location.zh-cn: 东京都千代田区隼町4番2号

description.zh-cn: 日本的最高法院及最高司法机关，根据《日本国宪法》设立，拥有对法律的最终解释权和违宪审查权。
description.en: The highest court and supreme judicial body in Japan, established under the Constitution of Japan, with ultimate judicial authority to interpret the law and conduct constitutional review.

description.zh-cn: 日本最高裁判所长官，于2024年8月16日就任。
description.en: Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of Japan, assumed office on August 16, 2024.

description.zh-cn: 日本的宪法，于1947年施行，规定了最高裁判所的设立及其作为最高司法机关的地位。
description.en: The constitution of Japan, enacted in 1947, which provides for the establishment of the Supreme Court as the highest judicial body.

description.zh-cn: 规定日本各级法院组织和运行的法律，最高裁判所的组织和运行亦依照此法。
description.en: A law that provides for the organization and operation of Japanese courts, under which the Supreme Court is organized and operates.

description.zh-cn: 日本在1947年《日本国宪法》实施前的最高司法机关，后被最高裁判所取代。
description.en: The highest judicial body in Japan before the enforcement of the 1947 Constitution of Japan, later replaced by the Supreme Court.

description.zh-cn: 日本建筑师，设计了最高裁判所的办公大楼。
description.en: A Japanese architect who designed the office building of the Supreme Court of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 由日本建筑学会颁发的建筑奖项。
description.en: An architectural award presented by the Architectural Institute of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 日本的最高行政机关，负责提名最高裁判所长官和任命最高裁判所判事。
description.en: The chief executive body of Japan, responsible for nominating the Chief Justice and appointing the other Justices of the Supreme Court.

description.zh-cn: 日本的国家象征，负责根据内阁的提名任命最高裁判所长官，并对最高裁判所判事的任命进行确认。
description.en: The symbol of the state of Japan, who appoints the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court as designated by the Cabinet and attests the appointment of other Justices.

en: Chief Justice of the Supreme Court

description.zh-cn: 日本最高裁判所的首长，由内阁提名并由天皇任命。
description.en: The head of the Supreme Court of Japan, designated by the Cabinet and appointed by the Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 日本最高裁判所的法官，除长官外共十四名，由内阁任命并由天皇进行确认。
description.en: A judge of the Supreme Court of Japan. There are fourteen such justices, appointed by the Cabinet and attested by the Emperor.

nodes.id: 最高裁判所裁判官国民审查

zh-cn: 最高裁判所裁判官国民审查
en: National Review of Supreme Court Justices

description.zh-cn: 日本一项特殊的公民投票制度，用于审查最高裁判所法官的适任性。
description.en: A special referendum system in Japan used to review the suitability of Supreme Court justices.

en: General Secretariat of the Supreme Court

description.zh-cn: 最高裁判所内设立的处理总务的机构，协助行使司法行政权。
description.en: An agency established within the Supreme Court to handle general affairs and assist in the exercise of judicial administrative power.

description.zh-cn: 最高裁判所的附属机构，负责培养法曹（法官、检察官、律师）。
description.en: An affiliated institution of the Supreme Court responsible for the training of legal professionals (judges, prosecutors, and lawyers).

description.zh-cn: 日本第20任最高裁判所长官。
description.en: The 20th Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 日本第19任最高裁判所长官。
description.en: The 19th Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 位于日本东京都的国立综合大学。
description.en: A national comprehensive university located in Tokyo, Japan.

description.zh-cn: 日本首任最高裁判所长官。
description.en: The first Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 《日本国宪法》第八章规定设立最高裁判所作为日本的最高司法机关。
description.en: Chapter VIII of the Constitution of Japan provides for the establishment of the Supreme Court as the highest judicial body of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 《裁判所法》规定了最高裁判所的具体组织和运行方式。
description.en: The Court Act specifies the detailed organization and operation of the Supreme Court.

description.zh-cn: 随着《日本国宪法》与《裁判所法》的施行，废除了大审院。
description.en: With the enforcement of the Constitution of Japan and the Court Act, the Supreme Court of Judicature was abolished.

position.en: Chief Justice of the Supreme Court

description.zh-cn: 今崎幸彦是现任最高裁判所长官。
description.en: Yukihiko Imasaki is the current Chief Justice of the Supreme Court.

description.zh-cn: 冈田新一设计了最高裁判所的办公大楼，该设计于1974年竣工。
description.en: Shinichi Okada designed the office building for the Supreme Court, which was completed in 1974.

description.zh-cn: 冈田新一因其设计的最高裁判所大楼而获得1974年第26届日本建筑学会奖。
description.en: Shinichi Okada was awarded the 26th Architectural Institute of Japan Prize in 1974 for his design of the Supreme Court building.

description.zh-cn: 最高裁判所长官由内阁提名。
description.en: The Chief Justice of the Supreme Court is nominated by the Cabinet.

description.zh-cn: 最高裁判所长官由天皇任命。
description.en: The Chief Justice of the Supreme Court is appointed by the Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 最高裁判所判事由内阁任命。
description.en: Justices of the Supreme Court are appointed by the Cabinet.

description.zh-cn: 天皇对内阁任命的最高裁判所判事进行确认。
description.en: The Emperor attests the appointment of Justices of the Supreme Court by the Cabinet.

relationships.source: 最高裁判所裁判官国民审查

description.zh-cn: 最高裁判所判事（包括长官）在任命后需要接受国民审查，此后每十年审查一次。
description.en: Justices of the Supreme Court (including the Chief Justice) are subject to a national review after their appointment and every ten years thereafter.

description.zh-cn: 最高裁判所事务总局是最高裁判所内设立的附属机构，负责处理总务。
description.en: The General Secretariat is an affiliated body within the Supreme Court responsible for handling general affairs.

description.zh-cn: 司法研修所是最高裁判所设立的附属机构，负责培养法律专业人才。
description.en: The Legal Training and Research Institute is an affiliated institution established by the Supreme Court for training legal professionals.

position.en: Chief Justice of the Supreme Court
Chief Justice of the Supreme Court

description.zh-cn: 大谷直人毕业于东京大学法学部。
description.en: Naoto Otani graduated from the Faculty of Law at the University of Tokyo.

position.en: Chief Justice of the Supreme Court
